verses.kjv: I am sought of them that asked not for me; I am found of them that sought me not: I said, Behold me, behold me, unto a nation that was not called by my name.
verses.ct: "I let myself be found by those who weren't looking for me. I revealed myself to those who never asked for me. I said, 'Here I am! Here I am!' to a nation that didn't carry my name."

verses.kjv: I have spread out my hands all the day unto a rebellious people, which walketh in a way that was not good, after their own thoughts;
verses.ct: "All day long I stretched out my hands to a defiant people who walk down a wrong path, following their own ideas."

verses.kjv: A people that provoketh me to anger continually to my face; that sacrificeth in gardens, and burneth incense upon altars of brick;
verses.ct: "These people constantly provoke me right in my presence — offering sacrifices in gardens and burning incense on brick altars."

verses.kjv: Which remain among the graves, and lodge in the monuments, which eat swine’s flesh, and broth of abominable things is in their vessels;
verses.ct: "They sit among the tombs and spend nights in secret places. They eat pork, and their pots are full of the broth of unclean meat."

verses.kjv: Which say, Stand by thyself, come not near to me; for I am holier than thou. These are a smoke in my nose, a fire that burneth all the day.
verses.ct: "They say, 'Stay away! Don't come near me — I'm too holy for you.' These people are like smoke in my nostrils, a fire that burns endlessly."

verses.kjv: Behold, it is written before me: I will not keep silence, but will recompense, even recompense into their bosom,
verses.ct: "Look, it is recorded right in front of me: I will not remain silent. I will pay them back — I will pay them back in full —"

verses.kjv: Your iniquities, and the iniquities of your fathers together, saith the LORD, which have burned incense upon the mountains, and blasphemed me upon the hills: therefore will I measure their former work into their bosom.
verses.ct: "for your sins and the sins of your ancestors combined," says the LORD. "They burned incense on the mountains and insulted me on the hills. So I will measure out the full payment for what they did before."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one saith, Destroy it not; for a blessing is in it: so will I do for my servants’ sakes, that I may not destroy them all.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "When juice is still found in a cluster of grapes, someone says, 'Don't throw it away — there's something good in it.' I will do the same for the sake of my servants, so that I don't destroy them all."

verses.kjv: And I will bring forth a seed out of Jacob, and out of Judah an inheritor of my mountains: and mine elect shall inherit it, and my servants shall dwell there.
verses.ct: "I will produce descendants from Jacob, and from Judah those who will possess my mountains. My chosen ones will inherit the land, and my servants will live there."

verses.kjv: And Sharon shall be a fold of flocks, and the valley of Achor a place for the herds to lie down in, for my people that have sought me.
verses.ct: "Sharon will become pastureland for flocks, and the Valley of Achor a resting place for herds — all for my people who have searched for me."

verses.kjv: But ye are they that forsake the LORD, that forget my holy mountain, that prepare a table for that troop, and that furnish the drink offering unto that number.
verses.ct: "But as for you who abandon the LORD and forget my holy mountain, who set a table for the god of Fortune and fill cups of mixed wine for the god of Destiny —"

verses.kjv: Therefore will I number you to the sword, and ye shall all bow down to the slaughter: because when I called, ye did not answer; when I spake, ye did not hear; but did evil before mine eyes, and did choose that wherein I delighted not.
verses.ct: "I will destine you for the sword, and all of you will kneel down for slaughter. Because when I called, you didn't respond. When I spoke, you didn't listen. Instead, you did what I consider evil and chose what displeases me."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD, Behold, my servants shall eat, but ye shall be hungry: behold, my servants shall drink, but ye shall be thirsty: behold, my servants shall rejoice, but ye shall be ashamed:
verses.ct: So the Lord GOD says this: "Look — my servants will eat, but you will go hungry. My servants will drink, but you will go thirsty. My servants will celebrate, but you will be put to shame."

verses.kjv: Behold, my servants shall sing for joy of heart, but ye shall cry for sorrow of heart, and shall howl for vexation of spirit.
verses.ct: "My servants will sing out of deep happiness, but you will cry out from a broken heart and wail from a crushed spirit."

verses.kjv: And ye shall leave your name for a curse unto my chosen: for the Lord GOD shall slay thee, and call his servants by another name:
verses.ct: "Your name will become a curse word among my chosen ones. The Lord GOD will put you to death, but he will give his servants a new name."

verses.kjv: That he who blesseth himself in the earth shall bless himself in the God of truth; and he that sweareth in the earth shall swear by the God of truth; because the former troubles are forgotten, and because they are hid from mine eyes.
verses.ct: "So whoever asks for a blessing on earth will ask it from the God of truth, and whoever makes an oath on earth will swear by the God of truth — because the old troubles will be forgotten and hidden from my sight."

verses.kjv: For, behold, I create new heavens and a new earth: and the former shall not be remembered, nor come into mind.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am going to create new heavens and a new earth. The previous things will not be remembered or even come to mind."

verses.kjv: But be ye glad and rejoice for ever in that which I create: for, behold, I create Jerusalem a rejoicing, and her people a joy.
verses.ct: "Instead, be glad and celebrate forever in what I create. I am going to create Jerusalem as a place of joy and its people as a delight."

verses.kjv: And I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people: and the voice of weeping shall be no more heard in her, nor the voice of crying.
verses.ct: "I myself will take joy in Jerusalem and delight in my people. The sound of weeping will never be heard there again, nor the sound of crying."

verses.kjv: There shall be no more thence an infant of days, nor an old man that hath not filled his days: for the child shall die an hundred years old; but the sinner being an hundred years old shall be accursed.
verses.ct: "No longer will an infant there live only a few days, and no longer will an old person fail to live a full life. A person who dies at 100 will be considered young, and anyone who fails to reach 100 will be thought of as cursed."

verses.kjv: And they shall build houses, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and eat the fruit of them.
verses.ct: "They will build houses and actually live in them. They will plant vineyards and actually eat their fruit."

verses.kjv: They shall not build, and another inhabit; they shall not plant, and another eat: for as the days of a tree are the days of my people, and mine elect shall long enjoy the work of their hands.
verses.ct: "They won't build for someone else to move in, and they won't plant for someone else to harvest. My people will live as long as trees, and my chosen ones will fully enjoy the work of their hands."

verses.kjv: They shall not labour in vain, nor bring forth for trouble; for they are the seed of the blessed of the LORD, and their offspring with them.
verses.ct: "They won't work for nothing, and they won't have children only to see them face disaster. They are the descendants of those blessed by the LORD, and their children along with them."

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, that before they call, I will answer; and while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
verses.ct: "Even before they call out, I will answer. While they are still speaking, I will hear them."

verses.kjv: The wolf and the lamb shall feed together, and the lion shall eat straw like the bullock: and dust shall be the serpent’s meat. They shall not hurt nor destroy in all my holy mountain, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "The wolf and the lamb will graze side by side. The lion will eat straw like an ox, and the serpent's food will be dust. Nothing will cause harm or destruction anywhere on my holy mountain," says the LORD.
